text: Hi there, have anyone tried out using the *“Get all custom actions”* endpoint in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|custom workflow action api page>? I keep receiving authentication credential error regardless of any API key or OAuth token. I’ve tried the API key in specific portal - :x:, Developer account API key - :x:, OAuth token - :x:
Hi All, just wanted to ask if we can use our own unique ID for contacts and companies, and later use this unique ID for update and association?

Hi, Is there a possibility to get all specific timeline events for a company?
_*Use case :*_ 
We have created a custom timeline event to track trips for companies. Now we want to know how many trips ( timeline activities ) are there for each company.

I am unable to create a unique field in contacts.
I got following error.
‘hasUniqueValue’ cannot be set on a contact property -
You _can_ via a custom property, but it may get messy. The default ID is automatically generated by HS and there's no way to disable or override that field once is set.
Yes it’s happened to me too
Someone could find a workaround to set `HubSpot_ALTERNATE_ID` to other property that is not `email`?

How can I get all the contacts with all the properties? Right now I’m receiving this:
```SimplePublicObjectWithAssociations {
    id: '1',
    properties: {
      createdate: '2022-02-23T20:36:07.679Z',
      email: '<mailto:emailmaria@HubSpot.com|emailmaria@HubSpot.com>',
      firstname: 'Maria',
      hs_object_id: '1',
      lastmodifieddate: '2022-02-23T20:36:22.297Z',
      lastname: 'Johnson (Sample Contact)'
    },
    createdAt: 2022-02-23T20:36:07.679Z,
    updatedAt: 2022-02-23T20:36:22.297Z,
    archived: false,
    archivedAt: undefined,
    associations: undefined
  },```
I want all the properties that are in HubSpot.
I’m using this method `HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.getAll()` of the SDK `@HubSpot/api-client`

Hi I have a question about CRM card extensions

I am working on validating the V3 signature hash with a CRM card extension custom action hook (confirmation hook to be specific).
the documentation says that the custom properties will be added to the end of the request, but I am finding that to not be the case. I am using a Lambda function to authenticate the request which jumbles the order of the query parameters in the original URI. when trying to generate the hash, the parameters need to be in a specific order.

Is there some way to view the URI that goes out with a custom action hook? I can see the intiail card extension request in the monitor section of the the developer portal, but not the actions.

I have used a guess and check method to find the true order of these params, but i am stuck with phone. I have tried it in every position and cannot get the hash to validate with that field added.

this is the definition of my custom action hook

```{
    type: 'CONFIRMATION_ACTION_HOOK',
    confirmationMessage: 'Are you sure you want to create this?',
    confirmButtonText: 'Yes',
    cancelButtonText: 'No',
    httpMethod: 'GET',
    uri:
      '<https://example.com/contact/create-user>',
    label: 'Create user',
    associatedObjectProperties: [
      'firstname',
      'lastname',
      'phone',
    ]
}```
again, I have been able to make this work with the `associatedObjectProperties` but the order does not match documentation, and I cannot get it to work with phone specifically (it even works with custom properies)
just a thought. perhaps you need a specific scope added to your app

Is it possible to create associations from standard objects (specifically, product) to a custom object? For clarification, I am referring to the meta-data level, not record level. I am currently getting an validation error against modification of a defined object type.

documentation I have been following:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards>

```associatedObjectProperties: A list of properties on the associated contact, company, deal, or ticket. If httpMethod is GET or DELETE, these property values will be appended to the URI of the request as query parameters. Otherwise, they'll be sent as a JSON request body```
This is not possible. Products are meant to act as a ‘library’ where you copy the contents into a Line Item, rather than associate a Product to a Line Item
You can create associations between standard objects to custom objects, just not Products to something else
anybody else having api inconsistent issues? ie the api get response to a hubdb table returns empty at times but also returns a result. with the same endpoints. response code 200 everytime.

okay, interestingly I found my solution. The issue was with a `+` character in the phone number. Typically you need to encode the URL parameters prior to creating the hash (this is specifically the case with `userEmail` ), but for some reason the `+` being encoded to `%2B` causes issues with the hash

Main issue is the screenshots below – around the API pulling back incorrect information compared to what is displayed in HubSpot:
